Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Chenopodiaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Chenopodiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Chenopodiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flower clusters apparently attached to petioles shortly above leaf axils
Leaves with narrow transparent margin, acute; fruiting perianth lobes inflated; seeds both horizontal and erect
Leaves without transparent margin, acute or obtuse; fruiting perianth not or barely inflated; seeds horizontal
Plants perennial under normal conditions, usually green; anthers c. 0.7 mm long; seed lenticular, dorsally rounded, with testa apparently smooth at x20 magnification.
Plants annual, tinged pink or red, glaucous; anthers c. 0.3 mm long; seed dorsally more or less acutely angled or even slightly keeled, with testa minutely colliculate at x20 magnification
